intro: Chaerophyllum trapezuntinum, commonly known as the Trapezuntine cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland margins and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
